p: A study by Bumandalai et al. [ 244] exhibited the potential of Chlorella vulgaris as biofertiliser for the germination of tomato and cucumber seeds. The length of the tomato and cucumber roots and shoots were improved using algal suspensions of 0.17 and 0.25 g/L, respectively. Treatment of plants with A. dimorphus biofertiliser before seedling transplant showed enhanced germination, increased production of branches and flowers compared to the control group and the treatment group applied during transplant [ 240]. Nayak et al. [ 245] successfully used de-oiled microalgal biomass of Scenedesmus sp. as biofertiliser to improve the growth of rice plant.
